content: Does VS code have translations for the full set of Unicode blackboard bold letters (or at least the uppercase ones)? I'd like to add them to emacs and I figure I should at least not give them different names than VS code if it has them.
@Johan Commelin don't you use ùïé? How do you type it?
There's \bbA, \bbB etc. and \A, \C, \F, \H, \K, \N, \Q, \R, \Z also produce blackboard symbols
Okay, that might be better since now I realize there are a number of other bold mathematical letter series in Unicode.
(I mean better anyways, even ignoring the fact that it's already used by VS Code.)
Maybe \A is there because I once wanted affine n-space? Of course i also want the adeles :-)
